title: (3600-136) Castro Daire - 89 Avenida António Serrado
description: Just off an n2 roundabout, 10 minutes walk into the town. Car park shaded by trees. There are picnic benches to sit at.  Day parking only.  we have a 7m motor home, and as car park, was pretty empty could manoeuvre without a problem.  if car park is busy, then probably more suited to a smaller camper van.

title: (3600-083) Castro Daire - 65 Rua Capitão Salgueiro Maia
title_short: (3600-083) Castro Daire - 65 Rua Capitão Salgueiro Maia
description: Easy parking above a sports field, with beautiful views and no lighting. Located in a quiet residential area, uncrowded at night, little traffic in the morning, some dogs barking at night. Not the most charming place, but good enough for one night.

title: (3600) Castro Daire - 6 Rua Cabine
description: Parking

title: (3600) Castro Daire - 1879 N228
description: Drinking water fountain well suited for filling water canisters. Large parking space.

title: (3600) Castro Daire - N228
description: Small dirt parking off the road. Surrounded by Eucalyptus trees. We just stopped to got for a walk, but for one night, it could be a nice, quiet spot.

title: (3600) Castro Daire - 2 Rua Estrada da Barragem

title: (3600) Castro Daire - 7 Largo Igreja

title: (3600) Castro Daire - 16 Rua Raposeira

For filling clean water only.
Public place.

title: (3600) Castro Daire -
description:
Idyllic place by the river for swimming and barbecuing. Free of charge. Toilets available but were closed (May 2023). No waste containers installed at the moment. Quiet night, but well attended when the weather is bathing.
Enjoy nature!

title: (3600) Pepim - N288
description: Old road overlooking a football field. a bit off the current road. In the middle of nature but without any particular charm. Helps out well for one night.

title: (3600-102) Castro Daire - 24 Rua da Portela
description:
Picnic area with a bombastic view, drinking water and the possibility to stand overnight.
Located on a 10km circular hiking trail. (information board at the church in the village)

Access rather nothing for huge ships.

title: (3600) Mamouros - CM1154

title: (3600) Castro Daire - 196 Rua Balneário Termal

name: Casa Estêvão

description:
This is a remote village that welcomes life. 
• Observe and feed the farm animals(sheep, goats, pig, rabbits, chickens, fishes)
• Picking a variety of fruits directly from the trees 
• Tasty products from the farm

title: (4690) - Er 321

title: (3660) Figueiredo de Alva -
description: Not very good access for motorhome but good enough for camping car. Quiet place surrounding by nature.

title: (3600) - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic area, play area for children, easy parking, shade, night possible, no service.

title: (3650) Coelheira - Unnamed Road
description: Very beautiful site in the middle of nature ideal for a night of stage. Much nicer than the car parks nearby, we came across this site by chance. We regret that we did not find it too late because we would gladly have spent the night. A fountain of spring water on site. Beware of fire, be particularly careful! a little further, the forest already burned. Respect this place as much on the cleanliness as on the risk of fire.

title: (3660-097) São Pedro do Sul - CM1123
description: Small vantage point. Very nice view over the valley in which there is a small village. However, you can hear the wind turbines.

title: (5100) Bigorne -

title: (3660) - N228
description: Small picnic or sleeping area, with barbecue and water. Near soccer fields and games for children. Very basic but little help if you are around. Nearby road.

title: (3515) Calde - Unnamed Road

title: (3600) Cabril -

title: (3650-020) Fráguas - 30 Rua Ponte Velha

title: (3660) São Pedro do Sul, Portugal - Unnamed Road

title: (3650) Vila Nova de Paiva - N329
description: Very shaded, stone benches and tables. Certainly possible for a night.

title: () - Unnamed Road
description:
Spacious flat place, good for visiting the magical village of Drave, walk 3.5 km until you get there. Easy route to the village and quite difficult on the return, since it is always uphill. There are about 300m of unpaved road to the place of overnight stay, it is not advisable to pass this place with the motorhome dirt road with parts with many deep holes.
Good trails.

title: (3660) Pindelo dos Milagres - Unnamed Road

title: (3610) Tarouca - Unnamed Road

title_short: (3650) Vila Nova de Paiva - 1 Largo Carvalhal

title: (4690) - Unnamed Road

title: (3650) Vila Nova de Paiva - N323

title_short: (3660) São Pedro do Sul - Unnamed Road

title: (3650) - Variante à N329

title: (3640) Segões - M581-1

title: (4540) Cabreiros -
description: Large flat surface to land in the middle of the ruins of the mine. Absolute tranquility, very few walkers during the day, and no one at night. To access the nearest waterfall, the trails are not easy to find, you have to go to the village above. Superb little hike where you pass through the galleries of the mine to access a heavenly place, be careful with young children, the path is steep. Access to the sector for large vehicles is quite tense, if not impossible, the roads are very narrow and dangerous.

title: () São Pedro do Sul - Rua da Fontinha
title_short: () São Pedro do Sul - Rua da Fontinha

Visiting the village and hot spring is a real pleasure. There is an outdoor pool on site, 10 minutes walk.

title: (3620) Leomil -

title: (4690) Cinfães -
description:
If you are visiting Northern Portugal, we also invite you to our paradise. Our land is 1.3 hectare big where you can park during the day and night although it is accesible mostly only with motorbikes, cars and vans because there is a 265cm wide bridge before our place which has a little bend too. But if you come without a motorhome, you can sleep here also in a tent under the starry sky. 

If you travel with your pet, he/she is welcome here too, just let us know before you come, because we also have two dogs. 

As for the toilet, we have only one compost toilet, what you can use as well. In addition, we provide water but the drinking water is limited because we bring it from a fresh spring nearby. At the moment, for electricity, we have only a solar system, which is also limited, we can charge just the usual devices with, like phones, laptop, etc.
Anyway, if you have some extra request, let us know, because we have hammocks, slack line, picnic table and cooking stuffs, like camping gas etc, what we can also offer.

If you got interested, come and swim under the waterfalls, relax and clear your mind in the nature, enjoy the sunset from a panoramic view and let's explore Cinfães and the beautiful Douro valley with its amazing features. 
The surroundings also offers many activities such as boating on the Douro river, hiking or biking in the embrace of majestic mountains, looking round the marvellous wine region, walking around the cobbled streets of the fabulous small cities and villages and much more programs.

The price applies to one vehicle and one person per night.

title: (3560) Sátão - 111 Rua Conde Dom Henrique
description: Municipal market free P, illuminated without trees. EXCEPT Sunday 00:00…15:00, when outside fare happens. To spend the night. Near the small town center with bars, restaurants and shopping. A bit noisy week as school is next. Possible also to sleep in the Intermarché parking or large free P front of firemen (Bombeiros) and police (GNR).

title: (5100-108) Lamego - 9 Rua de Almacave
description: Right in the center of the city next to the municipal market. Harder in the morning because that's why you support the market. Saturday afternoon and sleeping all day is quiet. Nearby restaurants and cafes.

title: () - EM552
description: Picnic area on the banks of the Douro, free parking, catering possible at the bar-restaurant in the village of Porto de Rei. Water point, swimming in the river possible or swimming pool.

title: (3610) Salzedas - 1 Praça António Pereira de Sousa
title_short: (3610) Salzedas - 1 Praça António Pereira de Sousa
description: Small car park on the left at the entrance of the village in front of a children's play area. Nice view of the convent. Valley of vineyards and pleasant village. Go to the restaurant next to the Casa do Forno convent: good and plentiful and the owner very kind.

title: (3510) Viseu - Estrada Florestal de Mozelos
description: There's not one specific spot, it's a nice forest where we believe you could park anywhere, it's full off spots, some of them would require a good ground clearance such as 4×4 vehicle, but some  spots are reachable with a simple CC

title: (3515-114) Viseu - 39 Avenida Aquilino Ribeiro

name: Camping Vouzela Park
title: () Camping Vouzela Park

title: (3660) - N227
description: If you looking for a place to sleep a few hours in a middle of a roadtrip this place may help you as much as it helped me...

title: (4660) Resende -
description: A small road that runs along the Douro on the left bank. A few narrow places. For a van, it's ok but the U-turn remains complicated. Nearby there is a pier for boats, and there is more room. The place is beautiful.

title: (4540) Moldes - CM326
description: Picnic park, balcony and an incredible view. Nice place and little moved, but at least not on the day I estive it.

title: (3670-261) Vouzela - 5 Porto Salto
description: Free public P in front of school (Escola Secundária) of Vizela small town, leveled and illuminated, either with or without trees. It lies 1 km away from historic center and long stone bridge ex-train and at higher level than town. Very quiet out of school activity.

title: (4640) Ancede - 173 Rua do Cruzeiro
description: I discovered this watering hole along the rota de romanico. The water tastes good and you can probably even wash clothes and/or dishes here. There is a large parking lot opposite.

title: (5100) Lamego - Unnamed Road
description: Place with breathtaking views of the Douro and the valley. Not had the opportunity to spend the night there (just a picnic) but very quiet and relaxing place. No service, antennas and wind turbines nearby.

title: (4540) Burgo -
description: In the middle of green at the end of the path there is a parking space for max. 2 campers. Relatively flat surface, accessibility okay. There is a drinking water tap at the beginning of the path and a barbecue area on the site itself.

title: (3670-261) Vouzela - 3 Largo Feira
description: Relatively quiet P with good space for big motorhomes but with big trees. Good start point for a visit to this nice small town. It is mountain bike center (see photo) including long flat bicycle track (Ecovia do Vouga) along previous train line that follows Vouga river deep valley, that has here very long stone bridge nearly over historic center as well as old steam locomotive on eastern top. As fare area is just opposite side of road (Largo da Feira), it may be busy on previous hours and along (once a month).

title: (4640) Baião - Unnamed Road
description: Heavenly place with a beach by the river. Three picnic tables, but no shade. Ideal for a swimming day.

description: Parking at local park, big enough for vans. We were only here during the day, but there was no apparent overnight ban.

title: (4690) - 88 N222
description: Tap for filling the water tank on a small picnic area

name: Avelal, santuário Senhor da Agonia
title: (3560) Avelal, santuário Senhor da Agonia
description: Free leveled parking in small sanctuary “Senhor da Agonia” on top of soft hill (round panorama from white&black top pin). Places with shadows and without. Several picnic tables and grill points. 1 km away from Avelal small village. Hike “Rota do Barrocal” (see photo).

title: () Viseu - Rua Fonte
description: Parking on paved street, very quiet, next to a nice natural park. No service, ideal for one night.

title: (4690) - CM1022
description: Picnic area at the edge of a small waterfall, tables, toilets, water point, bardecue. Beware, this place is on the road but not very busy. The TOP for a lunch, swimming, walking along the brook ...

title: (4540) Espiunca - EM505
description: Ground parking and boil, busy during the day and very quiet at night. Not very good entry. Ideal to access "the Paiva river footbridges"; spectacular infrastructure designed to take a walk of 8km enjoying a fantastic landscape. It is advisable to check out the entrance to the Tourism Office of Arouca beforehand

title: (4540) Espiunca - 12 Rua 1 de Maio
description: Water point

title: (3500) Viseu - PT Avenida Capitão Homem Ribeiro
title_short: (3500) Viseu - PT Avenida Capitão Homem Ribeiro
description: In the absence of places in the nearby ASA, there is this place where you can go to night.

title: (4540) - EM505
description: New area in Espiunca, at the beginning of the Paiva river walkways

name: Parque de Campismo de Mourilhe
title: (4690) Parque de Campismo de Mourilhe
description:
Mourilhe motorhome parking, camping and glamping, providing everything for a 5 star stay next to Douro River.
Prices start at 20 euros per night for a motorvan with 2 people and eletricity. 

Full price list at website

Motorhome Park | Bungalows | Restaurant | SPA | Gym | Swimming pool | Convenience store

title: (3510- 073) Viseu - Avenida Capitao Homem Ribeiro 199
description: 8 places on tarmac. Waste bins, gray water drain, free water with tap, two bins with tap, toilet door. FON Wi-Fi point nearby. Not far downtown and funicular.

title: (4640) Baião - N211
description: A small dirt parking lot can be level ready along the river Douro. A spring water source of the mountain. No development. Apparently very calm.

title: () Viseu - Avenida Emídio Navarro
description: Ample parking

title: (4690) Cinfães - CM1022
description: Above the dam that you can cross, on a connecting road over the Duro to the north! Quiet at night, around 6 o'clock the rush hour starts! Then it gets louder! Flat place!

title: (3500) Viseu - 110 Rua Arrabalde
description: Huge parking near the old town very quiet.

title: (4690) - Rua de Torneiros
description: Flat concrete parking with a view of the Carrapatelo dam. The parking lot is now closed. Great views over the river. Water can be found when you leave the main road 500 meters from the car park.

title: () - Unnamed Road
description: Parking that is taking a small road at the dam. There is a steep slope to go. A small concrete parking and another further down made of sand. We were on the second with our heavy weight. Opportunity to dive your feet in the Douro following the path at the end of the second parking. Do not be afraid of the way, it's pretty rocky. 5 minutes walk

title: (3500-048) Viseu - 144 Rua Arco
description: Huge car park, Monday and Wednesday but market day

title: (3500) Viseu - Rua Doutor Aristides Sousa Mendes
title_short: (3500) Viseu - Rua Doutor Aristides Sousa Mendes
description: Very quiet place with camping table and trees. And there is a water point

title: (3500-151) Viseu - 6 Avenida José Relvas
description: Lots of parking close to the sport area. quiet. close to the forest too and to the hostel. maybe they allow you to shower?

title: (4640) Santa M.nha do Zêzere - 131 Rua 20 de Junho
title_short: (4640) Santa M.nha do Zêzere - 131 Rua 20 de Junho
description: A big square with lots of parking slots. Next to the parking area is a playground, soccer field, a park with benches and a bar. The road is closed, but you can still enter to the square.

title: (4660-034) Fundo de Vila - 15 Rua da Boa Vista
title_short: (4660-034) Fundo de Vila - 15 Rua da Boa Vista
description: Water point on the church square. Uncontrolled water

title: (3500-151) Viseu - 6 Avenida José Relvas
description: Municipal swimming pool shower, ask at the reception

title: (5110) - CM1104
description: Ideal place for lovers of calm with breathtaking views of the vineyards and apple fields. End of paved road so no passage. (wind turbines nearby) We went up with a motorhome of 7,40m but beware of some turns that may require some maneuvering

title: (5110) Santa Cruz -
description: Picnic area in the chapel car park. 5 tables and stone bench to eat. Quiet in the middle of apple trees. Place for 7 CC easy!

title: (4540-117) Arouca - 9 Rua Alferes Diogo Malafaia
description: O Alphaite. Nice, clean laundry. For a few euros extra, you can leave your laundry behind and pick it up a few hours later.

title: () Paços de Gaiolo - N108
description: Great view of the Douro. On the N-108 road.

title: (4540) Arouca - Rua Sub-Ribes
description: Arouca, caravan park area, picnic area at the entrance of the city. Market day is 2 days every month. The rubbish is knee deep, left after the market. rendering the site filthy resembling the local dump.

title: (3680) Oliveira de Frades - 11 Rua Olheirão
description: Difficult to park in this a little mountainous town so the free illuminated parking in front of a school (700 m away from center) is interesting out lessons timetable. Hyper calm except around 8:15 when buses and cars drop off children.

title: (5100) - N226
description: A small shaded terrace with a superb view of the Douro, the route is little used at night and you sleep perfectly well.

title: (4660) bernardo - 914 EM537
description: Picnic area on the banks of the Douro with: toilets (whitewater), barbecues in free access, drinking water and even a small private beach! Access "Cais de Bernado"

name: Praia Fluvial de Trabulo
title: (3560) Praia Fluvial de Trabulo
description: Beach on Vouga river, with bar and facilities (closed out Summer). Larger P 300m away. Sanctuary N. Sr. dos Caminhos lies 1 km East.

title: () - EM612
description: A completely isolated spot on a slightly rough and muddy 4x4 trail, sheltered by rocky hills. We hiked to the top of eastern hill in the morning to watch the sun rise over the valley and the views were lovely!

title: (3620-339) Moimenta da Beira - 29 Rua Farol
description: Good place to rest. No service but super quiet. Possibility to spend the night without problem.

title: (5040) Matos - Bairro Doutor Sá Carneiro
description: Miradouro of São Silvestre Cimo do Douro. At the end of a very narrow and very steep road (only for small vehicles). Extraordinary panorama and calm. If you are not the first, be the second ... after that would be too crowded :-) No services, provide water ...

title: (3680) Oliveira de Frades - 3 Largo Feira
description: Large free public P on area of fair (Largo da Feira) that happens each 2nd and 4th Monday (when impossible to park night before). It is illuminated but not fully leveled. Near secondary road with low traffic by night. Easy walking distance (400m) till town center.

title: (5040) Vila Jusã - 614 N108
description: Magnificent source of drinking and fresh water with parking space. Although it does not have a sign, the neighbors have told us that it is drinkable.

title: (3560) Decermilo - Santuário N. Sr. dos Caminhos
title_short: (3560) Decermilo - Santuário N. Sr. dos Caminhos
description: Sanctuary “Nosso Senhor dos Caminhos” with several picnic tables with shadows and several parking.  Hike “Rota dos Míscaros” (mushrooms).

title: (3500-401) Viseu - 244 Rua dos Almeida Furtado
description: Lavaplus - Laundry Self Service. Opens 7am and closes 12am

title: (3510) Viseu -
description: Laundromat. Excellent service Portuguese, French and English spoken. Very clean. Self service. Cheap. Beside a cafe. Easy to park

title: (4540) - Unnamed Road
description: Enchanting place to spend time relaxing. LEAVE CLEAN!

title: (3500-046) Viseu - 276 Rua Cruzeiro
description:
It's a nice place to park or sleep.
It's side by a shopping Palacio de Gelo.
Can go to a shopping walk.
Large space to park motorhomes or sleep.
Not have amenities but in mall you have food, wc and wifi.

title: (3505) Viseu -
description: Intermarché Service Area

title: (3730) - EM612
description: Place, near a small chapel, where its charm is due to its wild character and its beautiful view!

title: (4550) Real - Unnamed Road
description: Clay trail leading to what appears to be a church. No one on the horizon, the spot is relatively clean compared to what we have already seen in Portugal, and above all the view is breathtaking. Thank you for leaving the right impeccable, even if it means picking up some papers that are not yours.

title: (5040) Mesão Frio - N101
description: We stopped by chance on this parking near the cemetery, calm assured! Go to the bottom of the car park, breathtaking views of the Douro Valley. The village is above.

title: (4550) Real -
description: Very nice picnic area (height: ~640m) with four tables and two covered grill stations. There is a water point and toilets, but they are not always open. The view is breathtaking and there is also a great swing. Next to the square there is a small chapel and a small stage.

title: (5040) Gafaria - N108
description: View point parking with a small buffet

title: (5110) Fontelo - 5110 CM1102
description:
Sao Dominos viewpoint parking.
Superb view of the Douro Valley.
"Uncontrolled" water point.

title: (5040) Mesão Frio - 305 Caminho Jardim
description: Small parking lot, we just landed kk instant but possible to sleep I think, pleasant.

title: (5040) Vila Marim - N108
description: Parking at the water's edge with a nice view. Surely quiet on weekdays but beware on Saturday night till 04.00 music in  the bar nearby. Toilets and showers available in self service.

title: (5040) Fontelas - N108
description: Caldas de Moledo Thermal Resort. There is parking at the entrance to the park which is free, pleasant and safe. Enough shade at Rio Douro 200 meters away.

title: (4625) Penha Longa - 3450 CM1276
description: Nice place on the banks of the Douro River.  Accessible up to 100 meters from the water's edge.  A small pier with the possibility of fishing and canoeing.  A small corner with a place for barbecue and a picnic table.  Also accessible to large motorhomes, a pleasant place for a stopover. Easy to get there and easy to leave.

title: (3640) Quintela - Lapa
description: Lapa, Sernancelhe - Large parking area close to the Santuário de Nossa Senhora da Lapa. A nice place to be visited.

title: (4640) Mesquinhata -
description:
Paved road leading to a motorable track, more for Vans and vans, with small spaces on the side to spend a cool and quiet night, almost at the top of the hill, in the middle of the pampas...
distant view of the Douro Valley.

title: (4540) - EM621
description: Parking place with picnic area, near the waterfalls of Frecha da Mizarela with nice view of the mountains. Quiet during the night.

title: (3730) Junqueira -
description: Nice shaded area (I didn’t take a picture of it but it’s there, really tall trees - the picture is the view from the trees) next to the road so pretty safe with many picnic tables and a nice view over the valley

title: (3680) Rua Da Pereira - 49 Rua São João
title_short: (3680) Rua Da Pereira - 49 Rua São João
description: Place next to the cemetery. Flat and perfect for one night. There was nothing else in this area. It has garbage cans. No more service. very quiet night

title: (3640) - 2 Avenida Padre Francisco Pinto Ferreira (EM584)
description: Peacefully parking to spend the night. so peaceful

title: (4540-013) Arouca - Zona de Merendas, Estrada da Serra da Freita
title_short: (4540-013) Arouca - Zona de Merendas, Estrada da Serra da Freita
description: Very secluded picnic area so if you are looking for peace and quiet.

address.street: Zona de Merendas, Estrada da Serra da Freita

name: Camping "Quinta das Corujeiras"
title: (4640) Camping "Quinta das Corujeiras"
description: Camping "Quinta das Corujeiras" A campsite offering only one place for a small van, rather difficult to access but in the middle of the vineyards: reservation highly recommended. Great location with hammock available. Showers and toilets very clean. No services for camper. Very welcome with proposal for a ride in the middle of a river to reach a small waterfall. Bread order possible.

title: (3500) Bairro da Misericórdia - 4A Rua Príncipe Perfeito
title_short: (3500) Bairro da Misericórdia - 4A Rua Príncipe Perfeito
description: Prince Perfeito Sports Center parking lot

title: (4640-187) Baião - 127 Rua Camões
description: Piece of land right next to galp gas station (with laundry machines). it's right next to the road but on a much lower level. fine to spend a night.

title: (5110) Armamar - N313
description: Revolution laundromat in good working order

title: (4540) - EM511
description: Picnic / barbecue area / walking paths beautiful views

title: (4540) Albergaria da Serra - M511
description: Parking to do the PR15 route of the Parideiras stones. Ample parking spaces and 2 explicitly for large vehicles such as motorhomes or buses. There is a picnic area right next door.

title: (3505-390) Viseu -
description:
Helped us switch our Swedish gas bottle for a Portuguese one, complete with adapter to fit our car. Very helpful and friendly staff. 
Muito obrigado!

title: (4640) Porto - N101
description: This parking is interesting because it has a source of drinking water. The locals come to use it.

title: (3620) Viseu - 7 Rua Barreira de Vide
description: Parking at the church in Vila de rua only stopped for lunch but no restrictions lovely flat large car park and well lit

title: (3670) Cambra - 2 CM1290
description: Service area with free park. the circular hiking route is signposted. nearby restaurants.

name: NaturVeredas, Refúgio da Freita
title: (4540) NaturVeredas, Refúgio da Freita
description:
Small campsite with basic services, located at 900m altitude. 
Good starting point for hikers.

title: (4640) Campelo - R. Abel Ribeiro
description: Very nice place for a picnic. Most pitches are sloping but there is shade. The showers and toilets were very clean. bring paper!

title: (4640) Campelo - 18 Rua do Montinhal
description:
New and free motorhomearea.
The service area is new. There are no signs indicating where it is. It is behind the municipal swimming pools and the sports hall.  Three places.

title: (3500) São João de Lourosa - A25
description: Fuel Station with free water in pump number #6, has a little of everything: playground, picnic tables, recycling garbage, electric car charge, ATM restaurant and Wi-Fi. Time limit to park and sleep 72 hours.

title: (5100-426) Lamego -
description: For one night, view of the requa bridges, quiet. Strobe light nearby in the early evening, not bothersome with curtains. Douro Museum 20min walk.
